conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to understand how shadows are cast by objects on the ground when a light source is positioned above them. The shadows will change in size and position as the light source moves.
The objects are a cake, a toilet paper roll, a soccer ball, and a postcard. The shadows are labeled A, B, C, and D.
Understand the relationship between the light source and the objects. The light source is positioned above the objects, casting shadows on the ground.

premise: When the light source moves to the right, the shadows will shift accordingly.
conclusion: The shadow of the objects will move to the right as well.

conclusion: However, the position of the shadows will change due to the movement of the light source.

premise: Determine the new positions of the shadows.
conclusion: The shadow of the cake will move to the right, the shadow of the toilet paper roll will move to the right, the shadow of the soccer ball will move to the right, and the shadow of the postcard will move to the right.

premise: Summarize the changes in shadow position.
conclusion: The shadows will move to the right as the light source moves to the right.
